question: What is the difference between RAM and ROM in computer systems?
correctAnswer: RAM is volatile (data is lost when power is off), while ROM is non-volatile (data persists even when power is off)
incorrectAnswers: RAM is faster than ROM, ROM is used for long-term storage
RAM is for processing, ROM is for storage
RAM is read-only, ROM is read-write
